Snow Free Albedo > Type: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Permafrost > List Of Gases: N/A
Soil > List Of Carbon Pools: DPM, RPM, BIO, HUM
Soil > Method: Heterotrophic respiration
Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type
Autotrophic Respiration > Maintenance Respiration: Whole plant (no distinction)
Autotrophic Respiration > Method: Parametrized
List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3
Phenology > Method: Parametrized
Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach
Surface Temperatures: 9
Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration
Scheme Method > Type Of Evaporation Formulation: Combined
Specific Tiling: Yes
Subsurface Tiling: No
Coupling With Rivers: No
Scheme Method > Dynamic Lakes Extent: No
Scheme Method > Endorheic Basins: No
Scheme Method > Ice Treatment: No
Scheme Method > Lakes Albedo: Other
Scheme Method > Lakes Dynamics: None
Snow Layers: 1
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow interception
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow melting
Scheme Method > Snow Albedo: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Ground snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Vegetation snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Density: Constant
Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Number Of Ground Water Layers: 4
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other
Interception: Yes
Scheme Method > Bio Geography: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Biomass: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > L A I: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Phenology: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: CO2
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Light
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Temperature
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Water availability
Specific Tiling: Yes
Vegetation Representation: Vegetation types
Vegetation Time Variation: Dynamical (varying from simulation)
Vegetation Types: Broadleaf tree
Vegetation Types: C3 grass
Vegetation Types: C4 grass
Vegetation Types: Needleleaf tree
Vegetation Types: Other
Citations
Title Clark 2008
Long Title Clark, D. B., and Gedney, N. (2008) Representing the effects of subgrid variability of soil moisture on runoff generation in a land surface model J. Geophys. Res., 113, D10, D10111.
Location --
Title Collatz 1991
Long Title Collatz, G. J., Ball, J. T., Grivet, C., and Berry, J. A. (1991) Physiological and environmental-regulation of stomatal conductance, photosynthesis and transpiration - a model that includes a laminar boundary-layer Agr. Forest Meteorol., 54, 107-136.
Location --
Title Collatz 1992
Long Title Collatz, G. J., Ribas-Carbo, M., and Berry, J. A. (1992) Coupled photosynthesis-stomatal conductance model for leaves of C4 plants Aust. J. Plant Physiol., 19, 519-538.
Location --
Title Cox 1999
Long Title Cox P. M., R. A. Betts, C. B. Bunton, R. L. H. Essery, P. R. Rowntree, and J. Smith (1999) The impact of new land surface physics on the GCM simulation of climate and climate sensitivity.. Climate Dynamics., 15, 183-203.
Location --
Title Cox 2001
Long Title Cox, P.M. (2001) Description of the TRIFFID dynamic global vegetation model.. Hadley Centre Technical Note 24, Hadley Centre, Met Office, UK.
Location http://www.metoffice.gov.uk/publications/HCTN/HCTN_24.pdf
Title Gedney 2003
Long Title Gedney, N., and Cox, P. M. (2003) The sensitivity of global climate model simulations to the representation of soil moisture heterogeneity J. Hydromet., 4, 6, 1265-1275
Location --
Title Mercado 2007
Long Title Mercado, L. M., Huntingford, C., Gash, J. H. C., Cox, P. M., and Jogireddy, V. (2007) Improving the representation of radiation interception and photosynthesis for climate model applications. Tellus, 59B, 553-565.
Location --

2D-Emissions > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: CMIP5 emission timeseries (monthly from linear interpolation of decadal means)

Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type

Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration

Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw

Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No

Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion

Title Johns_2006
Long Title Johns T.C., C.F. Durman, H.T. Banks, M.J. Roberts, A.J. McLaren, J.K. Ridley, C.A. Senior, K.D. Williams, A. Jones, G.J. Rickard, S. Cusack, W.J. Ingram, M. Crucifix, D.M.H. Sexton, M.M. Joshi, B-W. Dong, H. Spencer, R.S.R. Hill, J.M. Gregory, A.B. Keen, A.K. Pardaens, J.A. Lowe, A. Bodas-Salcedo, S (2006). "The new Hadley Centre climate model HadGEM1: Evaluation of coupled simulations." Journal of Climate, American Meteorological Society, Vol. 19, No. 7, pages 1327-1353.
Location --
Contacts
Role PI
Person Chris Jones
Organisation --
Address Met Office Hadley Centre, Fitzroy Road, Exeter, Devon, UK, EX1 3PB
Email chris.jones@metoffice.gov.uk
URL http://www.metoffice.gov.uk/research/our-scientists/climate-chemistry-ecosystems/chris-jones

Person Malcolm Roberts
Organisation --

Ocean > Advection

Properties
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Scheme Scope: Whole atmosphere
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Time Step Framework > Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry time stepping
Aerosol Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Modal scheme, mass as a tracer, number inferred from prescribed size distributions
Aerosol Key Properties > Family Approach: No
Aerosol Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: 3D mass/volume mixing ratio for aerosols
Aerosol Key Properties > Number Of Tracers: 21
2D-Emissions > Emitted Species: Sulphur dioxide, ammonia, fossil-fuel black carbon, fossil-fuel organic carbon, biomass-burning
2D-Emissions > Interactiv Emitted Species: Mineral dust, sea-salt, ocean-based DMS
2D-Emissions > Method: Interactive
2D-Emissions > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: CMIP5 emission timeseries (monthly from linear interpolation of decadal means)
2D-Emissions > Other Sources: Natural emissions from land surface of DMS and vegetation emissions
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Anthropogenic
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Bare ground
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Other
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Sea surface
3D-Emissions > Clim Emitted Species: Sulphur dioxide from degassing volcanoes, secondary organic aerosol
3D-Emissions > Climatology Type: Monthly
3D-Emissions > Method: Prescribed (climatology)
3D-Emissions > Source Types: Other
3D-Emissions > Source Types: Volcanoes
Concentrations > Prescribed Lower Boundary: N/A
Concentrations > Prescribed Upper Boundary: N/A
Concentrations > Prescribed Within Atmos: Biogenic aerosol
Aerosol Scheme > Bulk Species: BC (black carbon / soot)
Aerosol Scheme > Bulk Species: Dust
Aerosol Scheme > Bulk Species: Nitrate
Aerosol Scheme > Bulk Species: POM (particulate organic matter)
Aerosol Scheme > Bulk Species: SOA (secondary organic aerosols)
Aerosol Scheme > Bulk Species: Sea salt
Aerosol Scheme > Bulk Species: Sulphate
Aerosol Scheme > Scheme Type: Bulk
Coupling With: Clouds
Coupling With: LandSurface
Coupling With: Other
Coupling With: Radiation
Gas Phase Precursors: Ammonia
Gas Phase Precursors: DMS
Gas Phase Precursors: SO2
Ocean Biogeochemical Coupling: Provides ocean-based DMS emissions, and is fertilised by mineral dust deposition
Processes: Advection (horizontal)
Processes: Advection (vertical)
Processes: Ageing
Processes: Coagulation
Processes: Condensation
Processes: Dry deposition
Processes: Oxidation (gas phase)
Processes: Oxidation (in cloud)
Processes: Sedimentation
Processes: Wet deposition (impaction scavenging)
Processes: Wet deposition (nucleation scavenging)
Vegetation Model Coupling: Bare soil fraction for mineral dust emissions
Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry transport scheme
Turbulence > Method: Use same turbulence scheme as AtmosphericChemistry
Atmos Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Non-hydrostatic
Atmos Key Properties > Model Family: AGCM
Atmos Key Properties > Orography > Orography Type: Present-day
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Impact On Ozone: No
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Computation Method: Berger 1978
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Reference Date: 2000
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Type: Fixed
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Characteristics: Normalised to give a mean solar constant of 1365 Wm-2 over the 2 solar cycles 1860-1881.
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Type: Transient
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation: Via stratospheric aerosols optical thickness
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation Method: Monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, prescribed for quarter-spheres (90S-30S, 30S-0, 0-30N, 30N-90N)
Boundary Layer Turbulence > Counter Gradient: Yes
Boundary Layer Turbulence > Scheme Name: Other
Boundary Layer Turbulence > Scheme Type: Vertical profile of Kz
Deep Convection > Processes: Convective momentum transport (CMT)
Deep Convection > Processes: Detrainment
Deep Convection > Processes: Entrainment
Deep Convection > Processes: Radiative effects of anvils
Deep Convection > Processes: Updrafts and downdrafts
Deep Convection > Scheme Method: CAPE
Deep Convection > Scheme Name: Gregory and Rowntree
Deep Convection > Scheme Type: Mass-flux
Large Scale Precipitation > Precipitating Hydrometeors: Graupel
Large Scale Precipitation > Precipitating Hydrometeors: Hail
Large Scale Precipitation > Precipitating Hydrometeors: Liquid rain
Large Scale Precipitation > Precipitating Hydrometeors: Snow
Large Scale Precipitation > Scheme Name: Wilson and Ballard (1999; updated)
Microphysics > Processes: Cloud droplets
Microphysics > Processes: Cloud ice
Microphysics > Processes: Effect of graupel
Microphysics > Processes: Effect of raindrops
Microphysics > Processes: Effect of snow
Microphysics > Processes: Ice nucleation
Microphysics > Processes: Mixed phase
Microphysics > Processes: Water vapour deposition
Microphysics > Scheme Name: Smith (1990) for cloud amount and cloud water content; Wilson and Ballard (1999, updated) for cloud microphysics
Other Convection > Scheme Name: Mid-Level Convection
Other Convection > Scheme Type: Mass-flux
Shallow Convection > Method: Same as deep (unified)
Cloud Scheme Attributes > Cloud Overlap: Other
Cloud Scheme Attributes > Cloud Overlap Scheme: Maximum-random overlap
Cloud Scheme Attributes > Processes: Area cloud fraction, diagnostic RH_crit
Cloud Scheme Attributes > Separated Cloud Treatment: Yes
Sub Grid Scale Water Distribution > Coupling With Convection: Coupled with deep and shallow
Sub Grid Scale Water Distribution > Function Name: Symmetric triangular distribution
Sub Grid Scale Water Distribution > Function Order: One moment
Sub Grid Scale Water Distribution > Type: Diagnostic
C O S P Attributes > C O S P Run Configuration: Inline
C O S P Attributes > Number Of Columns: 100
C O S P Attributes > Number Of Gridpoints: All
C O S P Attributes > Number Of Levels: 38
I S S C P Attributes > Top Height: IR brightness and visible optical depth
I S S C P Attributes > Top Height Direction: Highest altitude level
Inputs Lidar > Lidar Ice Type: Ice spheres
Inputs Lidar > Overlap: Max / random
Inputs Radar > Radar Frequency: 94Ghz
Inputs Radar > Radar Type: Spaceborne
Inputs Radar > Use Effective Radius: Yes
Inputs Radar > Use Gas Absorption: Yes
Heat Treatment At Top: N/A
Horizontal Diffusion > Scheme Method: Iterated Laplacian
Horizontal Diffusion > Scheme Name: Horizontal diffusion scheme
Horizontal Discretization > Pole Singularity Treatment: Other
Horizontal Discretization > Scheme Method: Centered finite differences
Horizontal Discretization > Scheme Order: Second order
Horizontal Discretization > Scheme Type: Fixed grid
List Of Prognostic Variables: Clouds
List Of Prognostic Variables: Potential temperature
List Of Prognostic Variables: Vapour/solid/liquid
List Of Prognostic Variables: Wind components
Time Stepping Framework > Scheme Type: Semi-Implicit
Time Stepping Framework > Time Step: 30 minutes
Top Boundary Condition: Radiation boundary condition
Wind Treatment At Top: N/A
Momentum > Conservation Method: Conservation fixer
Momentum > Conserved Quantities: Total energy
Momentum > Scheme Characteristics: Staggered grid
Momentum > Scheme Name: Other
Momentum > Scheme Name Detail: Quasi-cubic
Momentum > Staggering Type: Arakawa C-grid
Tracers > Conservation Method: Conservation fixer
Tracers > Conserved Quantities: Tracer mass (all tracers)
Tracers > Scheme Characteristics: Cubic semi-Lagrangian
Tracers > Scheme Characteristics: Quintic semi-Lagrangian
Tracers > Scheme Name: Other
Non- Orographic Gravity Waves > Calculation Method: Spatially dependent
Non- Orographic Gravity Waves > Calculation Method: Temporally dependent
Non- Orographic Gravity Waves > Dissipation Scheme: Spectral
Non- Orographic Gravity Waves > Propagation Scheme: Non-linear theory
Non- Orographic Gravity Waves > Source Mechanisms: Background spectrum
Orographic Gravity Waves > Calculation Method: Other
Orographic Gravity Waves > Calculation Method Detail: Accounts for the anisotropy of the sub-grid orography in calculating the surface stress.
Orographic Gravity Waves > Dissipation Scheme: Single wave
Orographic Gravity Waves > Propagation Scheme: Linear theory
Orographic Gravity Waves > Source Mechanisms: Linear mountain waves
Orographic Gravity Waves > Source Mechanisms: Other
Sub Grid Scale Orography: Effect on drag
Aerosol Types: BC (black carbon / soot)
Aerosol Types: Dust
Aerosol Types: Nitrate
Aerosol Types: POM (particulate organic matter)
Aerosol Types: SOA (secondary organic aerosols)
Aerosol Types: Sea salt
Aerosol Types: Sulphate
Cloud Radiative Properties > Ice: Parameterised as function of ice mass mixing ratio and effective dimension.
Cloud Radiative Properties > Liquid: Parameterised as function of liquid mass mixing ratio and effective radius.
G H G- Types: CFC
G H G- Types: CH4
G H G- Types: CO2
G H G- Types: H2O
G H G- Types: N2O
G H G- Types: O3
Longwave > Number Of Spectral Intervals: 9
Longwave > Scheme Method: Two-stream
Longwave > Scheme Type: K-correlated
Shortwave > Number Of Spectral Intervals: 6
Shortwave > Scheme Type: Other
Shortwave > Scheme Type Detail: K-correlated
Time Step: 3 hours
Atm Chem Key Properties > Basic Approximations: See component description
Atm Chem Key Properties > Chem Scheme Scope: Troposphere
Atm Chem Key Properties > Coupling With Chemical Reactivity: No
Atm Chem Key Properties > Family Approach: No
Atm Chem Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: 3D mass/mixing ratio for gas
Atm Chem Key Properties > Number Of Tracers: 25
Atm Chem Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Clim Emitted Species: CO, Me2CO
2D-Emissions > Climatology Type: Monthly
2D-Emissions > Emitted Species: C2H6 ethane, C3H8 propane, CO carbon monoxide, HCHO formaldehyde, MeCHO acetaldehyde, Me2CO acetone, and NOx nitrogen oxides
2D-Emissions > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Method: Prescribed (climatology)
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: Prescribed monthly mean emissions (spatially non-unifoem) linearly interpolated from CMIP5 emissions provided as decadal means.
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Anthropogenic
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Bare ground
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Other
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Sea surface
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Vegetation
3D-Emissions > Emitted Species: NOx
3D-Emissions > Interactiv Emitted Species: NOx (nitrogen oxides)
3D-Emissions > Method: Interactive
3D-Emissions > Method: Other
3D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: Prescribed monthly mean emissions (spatially non-uniform) linearly interpolated from CMIP5 emissions provided as decadal means
3D-Emissions > Source Types: Aircraft
3D-Emissions > Source Types: Lightning
Concentrations > Prescribed Lower Boundary: CH4 (methane)
Concentrations > Prescribed Upper Boundary: O3 (ozone)
Atm Gas Phase Chemistry Attributes > Species: HOx
Atm Gas Phase Chemistry Attributes > Species: NOy
Atm Gas Phase Chemistry Attributes > Species: Ox
Atm Gas Phase Chemistry Attributes > Species: VOCs
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Advected Species: 25
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Bimolecular Reactions: 83
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Steady State Species: 9
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Termolecular Reactions: 13
Processes > Dry Deposition: Interactive
Processes > Oxidation: Yes
Processes > Wet Deposition: Yes
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Advected Species: N/A
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Reactions: N/A
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Steady State Species: N/A
Processes > Coagulation: No
Processes > Sedimentation: No
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Advected Species: N/A
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Reactions: N/A
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Steady State Species: N/A
Processes > Coagulation: No
Processes > Dry Deposition: Interactive
Processes > Wet Deposition: Yes
Species > Gas Phase: N/A
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Reactions: 25
Num Of Reactions And Species > Number Of Species: 18
Photolysis > Method: Offline (with clouds)
Photolysis > Reaction Data: Updated reaction absorption cross sections
Photolysis > Reaction Data: Updated reaction quantum yields
Convection: Convective fluxes connected to tracers
Dry Mass Conservation: Formally conserved
Mass Conservation: Other
Scheme Type: Semi-Lagrangian
Tracer And Moisture Conservation: Concentrations positivity and local adjustment, reset conservatively if necessary
Turbulence > Coupling With Chemical Reactivity: No
Turbulence > Type: 3D
Land Ice Key Properties > Land Ice Albedo: Prescribed
Mass Balance > Downscaling Technique: N/A
Land Surface Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Linearisation of the surface energy balance equations
Land Surface Key Properties > Conservation Of Properties > Lag Of Water Discharge: Simulated by river flow model
Land Surface Key Properties > Conservation Of Properties > Water Treatment: All water sent to ocean (with a lag)
Land Surface Key Properties > Coupling With Atmosphere: Implicit
Land Surface Key Properties > Genealogy: Other
Land Surface Key Properties > Land Cover Types: Bare soil
Land Surface Key Properties > Land Cover Types: Ice
Land Surface Key Properties > Land Cover Types: Urban
Land Surface Key Properties > Land Cover Types: Vegetated
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Canopy heat content
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Canopy skin temperature
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Canopy snow content
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Canopy water content
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Snow albedo
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Snow mass
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Soil heat content
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Soil ice content
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Soil moisture
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Soil temperature
Land Surface Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Surface skin temperature
Land Surface Key Properties > Tiling: Common to all LS subcomponents
Land Surface Key Properties > Tiling Method: Dynamic
Land Surface Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Method: Use Atmosphere time step
Snow Albedo > Function Of: Vegetation type
Snow Albedo > Type: Prognostic
Snow Free Albedo > Direct- Diffuse: No distinction between direct and diffuse albedo
Snow Free Albedo > Function Of: Vegetation state
Snow Free Albedo > Function Of: Vegetation type
Snow Free Albedo > Number Of Wavelengh Bands: 1
Snow Free Albedo > Type: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Permafrost > List Of Gases: N/A
Soil > List Of Carbon Pools: DPM, RPM, BIO, HUM
Soil > Method: Heterotrophic respiration
Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type
Autotrophic Respiration > Maintenance Respiration: Whole plant (no distinction)
Autotrophic Respiration > Method: Parametrized
List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3
Phenology > Method: Parametrized
Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach
Surface Temperatures: 9
Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration
Scheme Method > Type Of Evaporation Formulation: Combined
Specific Tiling: Yes
Subsurface Tiling: No
Coupling With Rivers: No
Scheme Method > Dynamic Lakes Extent: No
Scheme Method > Endorheic Basins: No
Scheme Method > Ice Treatment: No
Scheme Method > Lakes Albedo: Other
Scheme Method > Lakes Dynamics: None
Snow Layers: 1
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow interception
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow melting
Scheme Method > Snow Albedo: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Ground snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Vegetation snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Density: Constant
Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Number Of Ground Water Layers: 4
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other
Interception: Yes
Scheme Method > Bio Geography: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Biomass: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > L A I: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Phenology: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: CO2
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Light
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Temperature
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Water availability
Specific Tiling: Yes
Vegetation Representation: Vegetation types
Vegetation Time Variation: Dynamical (varying from simulation)
Vegetation Types: Broadleaf tree
Vegetation Types: C3 grass
Vegetation Types: C4 grass
Vegetation Types: Needleleaf tree
Vegetation Types: Other
Coupling With Atmosphere: Yes
Drainage Map: Present-day
List Of Prognostic Variables: Water
Reservoirs: 1
Oceanic Discharge > Quantities Transported: Water
Oceanic Discharge > Type: Direct (large rivers)
Quantities Exchanged With Atmosphere: Water
Resolution: Independent
Specific Tiling: Yes
Ocean Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Boussinesq
Ocean Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Non-hydrostatic
Ocean Key Properties > Bathymetry > Bathymetry Type: Fixed
Ocean Key Properties > Bathymetry > Reference Date: Present-day
Ocean Key Properties > Horizontal Discretization > Pole Singularity Treatment: Artificial island
Ocean Key Properties > Horizontal Discretization > Scheme Method: Finite differences
Ocean Key Properties > Horizontal Discretization > Staggering: Arakawa B-grid
Ocean Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Potential temperature
Ocean Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: SSH
Ocean Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Salinity
Ocean Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: U-velocity
Ocean Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: V-velocity
Ocean Key Properties > Model Family: OGCM
Ocean Key Properties > Non- Oceanic Water > Isolated Seas Mixing: Yes
Ocean Key Properties > Non- Oceanic Water > River Mouth Mixing: Addition of surface freshwater at river mouth
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Equation Of State: Other
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Freezing Point: Fixed
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Freezing Point Value: -1.8
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Specific Heat: Fixed
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Specific Heat Value: 3988.0
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Baroclinic Momentum: Leap-frog + Asselin filter
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Barotropic Solver: Leap-frog + Asselin filter
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Time Step: 3600
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Tracers: Leap-frog + Asselin filter
Lateral Tracers > Monotonic Flux Limiter: No
Lateral Tracers > Scheme Type: Centred 4th order
Momentum > Scheme Name: Second order centred, leapfrog
Momentum > Scheme Type: Flux form
Vertical Tracers > Monotonic Flux Limiter: No
Vertical Tracers > Scheme Type: Centred 2nd order

Ocean > Boundary Forcing

Properties
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Scheme Scope: Whole atmosphere
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Time Step Framework > Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry time stepping

2D-Emissions > Clim Emitted Species: CO, Me2CO

2D-Emissions > Method: Prescribed (climatology)
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: Prescribed monthly mean emissions (spatially non-unifoem) linearly interpolated from CMIP5 emissions provided as decadal means.

Land Surface Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Linearisation of the surface energy balance equations
Land Surface Key Properties > Conservation Of Properties > Lag Of Water Discharge: Simulated by river flow model
Land Surface Key Properties > Conservation Of Properties > Water Treatment: All water sent to ocean (with a lag)

Snow Albedo > Function Of: Vegetation type
Snow Albedo > Type: Prognostic
Snow Free Albedo > Direct- Diffuse: No distinction between direct and diffuse albedo
Snow Free Albedo > Function Of: Vegetation state
Snow Free Albedo > Function Of: Vegetation type
Snow Free Albedo > Number Of Wavelengh Bands: 1
Snow Free Albedo > Type: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Permafrost > List Of Gases: N/A
Soil > List Of Carbon Pools: DPM, RPM, BIO, HUM
Soil > Method: Heterotrophic respiration
Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type
Autotrophic Respiration > Maintenance Respiration: Whole plant (no distinction)
Autotrophic Respiration > Method: Parametrized
List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3
Phenology > Method: Parametrized
Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach
Surface Temperatures: 9
Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration
Scheme Method > Type Of Evaporation Formulation: Combined
Specific Tiling: Yes
Subsurface Tiling: No
Coupling With Rivers: No
Scheme Method > Dynamic Lakes Extent: No
Scheme Method > Endorheic Basins: No
Scheme Method > Ice Treatment: No
Scheme Method > Lakes Albedo: Other
Scheme Method > Lakes Dynamics: None
Snow Layers: 1
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow interception
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow melting
Scheme Method > Snow Albedo: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Ground snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Vegetation snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Density: Constant
Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Number Of Ground Water Layers: 4
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other
Interception: Yes
Scheme Method > Bio Geography: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Biomass: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > L A I: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Phenology: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: CO2
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Light
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Temperature
Scheme Method > Stomatal Resistance Function Of: Water availability
Specific Tiling: Yes
Vegetation Representation: Vegetation types
Vegetation Time Variation: Dynamical (varying from simulation)
Vegetation Types: Broadleaf tree
Vegetation Types: C3 grass
Vegetation Types: C4 grass
Vegetation Types: Needleleaf tree
Vegetation Types: Other
Coupling With Atmosphere: Yes
Drainage Map: Present-day
List Of Prognostic Variables: Water
Reservoirs: 1

Resolution: Independent

Ocean Key Properties > Non- Oceanic Water > River Mouth Mixing: Addition of surface freshwater at river mouth
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Equation Of State: Other
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Freezing Point: Fixed
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Freezing Point Value: -1.8
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Specific Heat: Fixed
Ocean Key Properties > Sea Water > Specific Heat Value: 3988.0
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Baroclinic Momentum: Leap-frog + Asselin filter
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Barotropic Solver: Leap-frog + Asselin filter
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Time Step: 3600
Ocean Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Tracers: Leap-frog + Asselin filter
Lateral Tracers > Monotonic Flux Limiter: No
Lateral Tracers > Scheme Type: Centred 4th order
Momentum > Scheme Name: Second order centred, leapfrog
Momentum > Scheme Type: Flux form
Vertical Tracers > Monotonic Flux Limiter: No
Vertical Tracers > Scheme Type: Centred 2nd order
Momentum > Bottom Friction: Non-linear
Momentum > Lateral Friction: No-slip

Properties
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Scheme Scope: Whole atmosphere
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Time Step Framework > Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry time stepping
Aerosol Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Modal scheme, mass as a tracer, number inferred from prescribed size distributions
Aerosol Key Properties > Family Approach: No
Aerosol Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: 3D mass/volume mixing ratio for aerosols
Aerosol Key Properties > Number Of Tracers: 21
2D-Emissions > Emitted Species: Sulphur dioxide, ammonia, fossil-fuel black carbon, fossil-fuel organic carbon, biomass-burning
2D-Emissions > Interactiv Emitted Species: Mineral dust, sea-salt, ocean-based DMS
2D-Emissions > Method: Interactive
2D-Emissions > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: CMIP5 emission timeseries (monthly from linear interpolation of decadal means)
2D-Emissions > Other Sources: Natural emissions from land surface of DMS and vegetation emissions
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Anthropogenic
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Bare ground
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Other
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Sea surface

3D-Emissions > Method: Prescribed (climatology)
3D-Emissions > Source Types: Other
3D-Emissions > Source Types: Volcanoes

Concentrations > Prescribed Upper Boundary: N/A

Gas Phase Precursors: DMS
Gas Phase Precursors: SO2
Ocean Biogeochemical Coupling: Provides ocean-based DMS emissions, and is fertilised by mineral dust deposition
Processes: Advection (horizontal)
Processes: Advection (vertical)
Processes: Ageing
Processes: Coagulation
Processes: Condensation
Processes: Dry deposition
Processes: Oxidation (gas phase)
Processes: Oxidation (in cloud)
Processes: Sedimentation
Processes: Wet deposition (impaction scavenging)
Processes: Wet deposition (nucleation scavenging)
Vegetation Model Coupling: Bare soil fraction for mineral dust emissions
Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry transport scheme
Turbulence > Method: Use same turbulence scheme as AtmosphericChemistry
Atmos Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Non-hydrostatic
Atmos Key Properties > Model Family: AGCM
Atmos Key Properties > Orography > Orography Type: Present-day
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Impact On Ozone: No
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Computation Method: Berger 1978
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Reference Date: 2000
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Type: Fixed
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Characteristics: Normalised to give a mean solar constant of 1365 Wm-2 over the 2 solar cycles 1860-1881.
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Type: Transient
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation: Via stratospheric aerosols optical thickness
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation Method: Monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, prescribed for quarter-spheres (90S-30S, 30S-0, 0-30N, 30N-90N)
Boundary Layer Turbulence > Counter Gradient: Yes
Boundary Layer Turbulence > Scheme Name: Other
Boundary Layer Turbulence > Scheme Type: Vertical profile of Kz

Deep Convection > Processes: Radiative effects of anvils
Deep Convection > Processes: Updrafts and downdrafts
Deep Convection > Scheme Method: CAPE
Deep Convection > Scheme Name: Gregory and Rowntree
Deep Convection > Scheme Type: Mass-flux

Large Scale Precipitation > Precipitating Hydrometeors: Hail
Large Scale Precipitation > Precipitating Hydrometeors: Liquid rain

Other Convection > Scheme Name: Mid-Level Convection
Other Convection > Scheme Type: Mass-flux
Shallow Convection > Method: Same as deep (unified)

Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type

List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3
Phenology > Method: Parametrized
Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach
Surface Temperatures: 9
Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration
Scheme Method > Type Of Evaporation Formulation: Combined
Specific Tiling: Yes
Subsurface Tiling: No
Coupling With Rivers: No
Scheme Method > Dynamic Lakes Extent: No
Scheme Method > Endorheic Basins: No
Scheme Method > Ice Treatment: No
Scheme Method > Lakes Albedo: Other
Scheme Method > Lakes Dynamics: None
Snow Layers: 1
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow interception
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow melting
Scheme Method > Snow Albedo: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Ground snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Vegetation snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Density: Constant
Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other

Vertical Tracers > Monotonic Flux Limiter: No
Vertical Tracers > Scheme Type: Centred 2nd order
Momentum > Bottom Friction: Non-linear
Momentum > Lateral Friction: No-slip
Momentum > Surface Flux Correction: No
Sunlight Penetration > Ocean Color Dependent: No
Sunlight Penetration > Scheme Type: 2 extinction depths
Surface Salinity > From Atmosphere: Freshwater flux
Surface Salinity > From River: Freshwater flux
Surface Salinity > From Sea Ice: Freshwater flux
Eddy Viscosity Coefficient > Coefficient Type: Space varying
Eddy Viscosity Coefficient > Minimal Background Value: 0
Eddy Viscosity Coefficient > Spatial Variation: Latitude
Operator > Direction: Geopotential
Operator > Discretization: Second order
Operator > Order: Bi-harmonic (fourth order)
Citations

Ocean > Lateral Physics > Tracers

Properties
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Scheme Scope: Whole atmosphere
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Time Step Framework > Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry time stepping
Aerosol Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Modal scheme, mass as a tracer, number inferred from prescribed size distributions
Aerosol Key Properties > Family Approach: No
Aerosol Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: 3D mass/volume mixing ratio for aerosols
Aerosol Key Properties > Number Of Tracers: 21
2D-Emissions > Emitted Species: Sulphur dioxide, ammonia, fossil-fuel black carbon, fossil-fuel organic carbon, biomass-burning
2D-Emissions > Interactiv Emitted Species: Mineral dust, sea-salt, ocean-based DMS
2D-Emissions > Method: Interactive
2D-Emissions > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: CMIP5 emission timeseries (monthly from linear interpolation of decadal means)
2D-Emissions > Other Sources: Natural emissions from land surface of DMS and vegetation emissions

2D-Emissions > Source Types: Bare ground
2D-Emissions > Source Types: Other

3D-Emissions > Source Types: Volcanoes

Atmos Key Properties > Model Family: AGCM
Atmos Key Properties > Orography > Orography Type: Present-day
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Impact On Ozone: No
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Computation Method: Berger 1978
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Reference Date: 2000
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Type: Fixed
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Characteristics: Normalised to give a mean solar constant of 1365 Wm-2 over the 2 solar cycles 1860-1881.
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Type: Transient
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation: Via stratospheric aerosols optical thickness
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation Method: Monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, prescribed for quarter-spheres (90S-30S, 30S-0, 0-30N, 30N-90N)

Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No

Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other

Soil > List Of Carbon Pools: DPM, RPM, BIO, HUM
Soil > Method: Heterotrophic respiration
Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type
Autotrophic Respiration > Maintenance Respiration: Whole plant (no distinction)
Autotrophic Respiration > Method: Parametrized
List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3
Phenology > Method: Parametrized
Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach

Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration

Scheme Method > Snow Density: Constant
Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other

Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Type: Fixed
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Characteristics: Normalised to give a mean solar constant of 1365 Wm-2 over the 2 solar cycles 1860-1881.

Soil > List Of Carbon Pools: DPM, RPM, BIO, HUM
Soil > Method: Heterotrophic respiration
Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type

List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3
Phenology > Method: Parametrized
Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach
Surface Temperatures: 9
Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration
Scheme Method > Type Of Evaporation Formulation: Combined
Specific Tiling: Yes
Subsurface Tiling: No
Coupling With Rivers: No
Scheme Method > Dynamic Lakes Extent: No
Scheme Method > Endorheic Basins: No
Scheme Method > Ice Treatment: No
Scheme Method > Lakes Albedo: Other
Scheme Method > Lakes Dynamics: None
Snow Layers: 1
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow interception
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow melting
Scheme Method > Snow Albedo: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Ground snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Vegetation snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Density: Constant
Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other
Interception: Yes
Scheme Method > Bio Geography: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Biomass: Diagnostic

Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)

Properties
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Scheme Scope: Whole atmosphere
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Time Step Framework > Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry time stepping
Aerosol Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Modal scheme, mass as a tracer, number inferred from prescribed size distributions
Aerosol Key Properties > Family Approach: No
Aerosol Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: 3D mass/volume mixing ratio for aerosols
Aerosol Key Properties > Number Of Tracers: 21
2D-Emissions > Emitted Species: Sulphur dioxide, ammonia, fossil-fuel black carbon, fossil-fuel organic carbon, biomass-burning
2D-Emissions > Interactiv Emitted Species: Mineral dust, sea-salt, ocean-based DMS
2D-Emissions > Method: Interactive
2D-Emissions > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: CMIP5 emission timeseries (monthly from linear interpolation of decadal means)
2D-Emissions > Other Sources: Natural emissions from land surface of DMS and vegetation emissions

2D-Emissions > Source Types: Bare ground

Turbulence > Method: Use same turbulence scheme as AtmosphericChemistry

Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Type: Fixed
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Characteristics: Normalised to give a mean solar constant of 1365 Wm-2 over the 2 solar cycles 1860-1881.
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Type: Transient
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation: Via stratospheric aerosols optical thickness
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation Method: Monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, prescribed for quarter-spheres (90S-30S, 30S-0, 0-30N, 30N-90N)

Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw

Ocean Bio-Geo Chem.

Properties
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Scheme Scope: Whole atmosphere
Aerosol Key Properties > Aerosol Time Step Framework > Method: Uses AtmosphericChemistry time stepping
Aerosol Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Modal scheme, mass as a tracer, number inferred from prescribed size distributions

Aerosol Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: 3D mass/volume mixing ratio for aerosols

2D-Emissions > Method: Interactive
2D-Emissions > Method: Other
2D-Emissions > Method Characteristics: CMIP5 emission timeseries (monthly from linear interpolation of decadal means)

Atmos Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Non-hydrostatic
Atmos Key Properties > Model Family: AGCM
Atmos Key Properties > Orography > Orography Type: Present-day
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Impact On Ozone: No
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Computation Method: Berger 1978
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Reference Date: 2000
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Orbital Parameters > Type: Fixed
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Characteristics: Normalised to give a mean solar constant of 1365 Wm-2 over the 2 solar cycles 1860-1881.
Atmos Key Properties > Top Of Atmos Insolation > Solar Constant > Type: Transient
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation: Via stratospheric aerosols optical thickness
Atmos Key Properties > Volcanoes Implementation Method: Monthly stratospheric optical depths, at 550nm, prescribed for quarter-spheres (90S-30S, 30S-0, 0-30N, 30N-90N)

Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots

Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Number Of Ground Water Layers: 4
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation
Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other
Interception: Yes

Scheme Method > Biomass: Diagnostic

Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion

Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other

Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type

Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No

Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion

Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other

Soil > List Of Carbon Pools: DPM, RPM, BIO, HUM
Soil > Method: Heterotrophic respiration
Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type
Autotrophic Respiration > Maintenance Respiration: Whole plant (no distinction)
Autotrophic Respiration > Method: Parametrized
List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3

Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach

Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No
Runoff- Drainage > Method: Differentiated drainage and runoff
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Deep drainage
Runoff- Drainage > Processes: Infiltration excess runoff

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion
Soil Moisture Freezing > Ice Storage Method: Prognostic frozen fraction of saturation

Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other

Soil > List Of Carbon Pools: DPM, RPM, BIO, HUM
Soil > Method: Heterotrophic respiration
Soil > Number Of Carbon Pools: 4
Allocation > Allocation Bins: Leaves + stems + roots
Allocation > Allocation Fractions: Function of vegetation type
Autotrophic Respiration > Maintenance Respiration: Whole plant (no distinction)
Autotrophic Respiration > Method: Parametrized
List Of Carbon Pools: Leaf, wood, root carbon. [These are diagnosed from the canopy height and LAI of the vegetation]
Carbon Pools: 3
Phenology > Method: Parametrized
Photosynthesis > Method: Carbon assimilation approach
Surface Temperatures: 9
Scheme Method > Processes: Transpiration
Scheme Method > Type Of Evaporation Formulation: Combined
Specific Tiling: Yes
Subsurface Tiling: No
Coupling With Rivers: No
Scheme Method > Dynamic Lakes Extent: No
Scheme Method > Endorheic Basins: No
Scheme Method > Ice Treatment: No
Scheme Method > Lakes Albedo: Other
Scheme Method > Lakes Dynamics: None
Snow Layers: 1
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow interception
Scheme Method > Processes: Snow melting
Scheme Method > Snow Albedo: Diagnostic
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Ground snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Cover Fractions: Vegetation snow fraction
Scheme Method > Snow Density: Constant
Scheme Method > Snow Heat Content: Other
Scheme Method > Snow Temperature: Prognostic
Scheme Method > Snow Water Equivalent: Prognostic
Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw

Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw

Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw

Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw

Specific Tiling: Yes
Soil Map > Albedo: Derived from MODIS data as defined in Houldcroft et al. (2008)
Soil Map > Structure: The soil has four layers of increasing thickness up to a depth of 3m each with the same soil properties. In addition there is a deeper layer (extending down to 6m below the surface) which has a saturated hydraulic conductivity which decreases exponentially with depth (Gedney and Cox, 2003)
Soil Map > Texture: Soil properties are derived from fractions of clay, sand and silt defined in the datasets available from the IGBP DIS
Soil Map > Water Table: As described in Gedney and Cox (2003)
Method > Heat Storage: Explicit diffusion
Method > Processes: Soil moisture freeze-thaw
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Number Of Ground Heat Layers: 4
Soil Heat Treatment Attributes > Specific Tiling: No

Soil Hydrology Attributes > Water Storage Method: Explicit diffusion

Soil Moisture Freezing > Number Of Ground Ice Layers: 4
Soil Moisture Freezing > Permafrost: Other

Sea Ice Key Properties > Basic Approximations: Multiple ice thickness categories (5 + open water); zero layer thermodynamics; EVP dynamics and ridging scheme
Sea Ice Key Properties > List Of Prognostic Variables: Ice concentration (per thickness category), grid box mean ice thickness (per thickness category), grid box mean snow thickness (per thickness category), surface snow or ice temperature (per thickness category), ice velocities, internal ice stress tensors
Sea Ice Key Properties > Sea Ice Representation > Scheme Type: Other
Sea Ice Key Properties > Time Stepping Framework > Method: Use Ocean time step
Advection: Other
Advection Type: First-order upwind
Horizontal Discretization Grid: Ocean grid
Redistribution > Ice Strength Formulation: Hibler(1979). P* =20,000Nm-2 and c=20
Redistribution > Type: Ridging
Rheology: EVP
Ice > Brine Inclusions: None
Ice > Ocean To Ice Basal Heat Flux: Parametrized (calculated in SeaIce)
Ice > Processes: Other
Ice > Processes: Surface sublimation
Ice > Transport In Thickness Space: Linear remapping
Ice > Vertical Heat Diffusion: One layer
New Ice Formation: Frazil ice forms with a thickness of 5cm when the temperature of the top ocean layer falls below freezing. The volume of new ice is determined by the heat required to bring the ocean surface temperature back to freezing.
Snow > Heat Diffusion: One layer
Snow > Scheme Type: Other
Snow > Scheme Type: Snow-ice
Snow > Snow Scheme: Includes sublimation
Surface Albedo: Curry et al. (2001) parameterization, with adjustment of Semtner (1987) to compensate for zero layer thermodynamics. Also, thin and partial snow cover scheme for snow albedo (Cox et al, 1999). Albedo parameters: bare ice = 0.61; melting deep snow on seaice = 0.65; cold deep snow on seaice = 0.8.
Water Ponds: No
